sentences.english: The sick boy lay in bed and whimpered.
sentences.chinese: 那病童躺在床上呜咽啜泣。

sentences.english: I was wrong. I am sorry, ” Yang says over and over again.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，”杨啜泣着反复说到。

sentences.english: She was sobbing her loneliness into her pillow.
sentences.chinese: 她伏枕啜泣以泄心中的孤寂。

sentences.english: The line was quiet except for the cries of the boy's mother.
sentences.chinese: 电话那端沉默了，只能听到母亲的啜泣声。

sentences.english: She fell back with a little cry as I entered.
sentences.chinese: 看到我进来，她向后退了几步，还有一点小啜泣。

sentences.english: I started to shake, and then I began sobbing.
sentences.chinese: 我开始颤抖，然后便啜泣起来。

sentences.english: Every note was a sigh, a sob, a groan of awful mournfulness.
sentences.chinese: 每一声都是叹息，是啜泣，是悲哀至极的呻吟。

sentences.english: You will no doubt begin to moan, groan and whimper.
sentences.chinese: 你肯会开始不住的呻吟和啜泣。

sentences.english: Behind me I could hear the sobbing of the Vietnamese who were now gathering.
sentences.chinese: 我听见身后有越南人的啜泣声，他们正聚集到这里来。

sentences.english: The disappointed boy gulped down a sob and tried to smile.
sentences.chinese: 这个失望的男孩忍住啜泣，强作笑脸。

sentences.english: The boredom cry is often rhythmical and also contains sobbing and moans.
sentences.chinese: 无聊引起的哭泣通常富有节奏感，夹杂啜泣和呜咽。

sentences.english: The little girl started to whimper when she couldn't have a cookie.
sentences.chinese: 那个小女孩因为不能吃饼干而啜泣了起来。

sentences.english: Glittering in the moonlight, she saw a woman weeping.
sentences.chinese: 在明亮的月光下，她见一个女人在那啜泣。

sentences.english: Later, when one of the boys is alone, he weeps.
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿，当其中的一个男孩落单时，他开始啜泣。
“我还有其他电影，”卡尔啜泣起来。

definition: to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to choke with emotion/to choke with sobs
